title.zh: 《呂太后本紀》Annals of Empress Dowager Lü
title.raw: 《呂太后本紀》Annals of Empress Dowager Lü

sentences.zh: 呂太后者，高祖微時妃也，生孝惠帝、女魯元太后。

translations.text: Empress Dowager Lü was Gao Zu's consort from his humble days; she gave birth to Emperor Xiaohui and her daughter Grand Empress Dowager Lu Yuan.

sentences.zh: 及高祖為漢王，得定陶戚姬，愛幸，生趙隱王如意。

translations.text: When Gao Zu became King of Han, he obtained Consort Qi of Dingtao, whom he loved and favored; she gave birth to King Yin of Zhao, Ruyi.

sentences.zh: 孝惠為人仁弱，高祖以為不類我，常欲廢太子，立戚姬子如意，如意類我。

translations.text: Emperor Xiaohui as a person was benevolent and weak; Gao Zu considered he did not resemble him and constantly wished to depose the Crown Prince and install Consort Qi's son Ruyi, who resembled him.

sentences.zh: 戚姬幸，常從上之關東，日夜啼泣，欲立其子代太子。

translations.text: Consort Qi was favored and constantly followed the superior east of the passes, weeping day and night, wishing to have her son replace the Crown Prince.

sentences.zh: 呂后年長，常留守，希見上，益疏。

translations.text: Empress Lü was older and constantly remained behind on guard duty, rarely seeing the superior, and grew increasingly estranged.

sentences.zh: 如意立為趙王後，幾代太子者數矣，賴大臣爭之，及留侯策，太子得毋廢。

translations.text: After Ruyi was installed as King of Zhao, he nearly replaced the Crown Prince several times; they relied on the great ministers to争 for it, as well as the Marquis of Liu's strategy, and the Crown Prince was able to avoid being deposed.

Empress Dowager Lü was Gao Zu's consort from his humble days; she gave birth to Emperor Xiaohui and her daughter Grand Empress Dowager Lu Yuan. When Gao Zu became King of Han, he obtained Consort Qi of Dingtao, whom he loved and favored; she gave birth to King Yin of Zhao, Ruyi. Emperor Xiaohui as a person was benevolent and weak; Gao Zu considered he did not resemble him and constantly wished to depose the Crown Prince and install Consort Qi's son Ruyi, who resembled him. Consort Qi was favored and constantly followed the superior east of the passes, weeping day and night, wishing to have her son replace the Crown Prince. Empress Lü was older and constantly remained behind on guard duty, rarely seeing the superior, and grew increasingly estranged. After Ruyi was installed as King of Zhao, he nearly replaced the Crown Prince several times; they relied on the great ministers to争 for it, as well as the Marquis of Liu's strategy, and the Crown Prince was able to avoid being deposed.

sentences.zh: 呂后為人剛毅，佐高祖定天下，所誅大臣多呂后力。

translations.text: Empress Lü as a person was firm and resolute; she assisted Gao Zu in settling all under Heaven, and many of the great ministers who were executed owed much to Empress Lü's strength.

sentences.zh: 呂后兄二人，皆為將。

translations.text: Empress Lü had two elder brothers, both of whom served as generals.

sentences.zh: 長兄周呂侯死事，封其子呂臺為酈侯，子產為交侯；

translations.text: The eldest brother Lord Zhou Lü died in service; they enfeoffed his son Lü Tai as Marquis of Li and his son Chan as Marquis of Jiao;

sentences.zh: 次兄呂釋之為建成侯。

translations.text: the next elder brother Lü Shizhi was Marquis of Jiancheng.

Empress Lü as a person was firm and resolute; she assisted Gao Zu in settling all under Heaven, and many of the great ministers who were executed owed much to Empress Lü's strength. Empress Lü had two elder brothers, both of whom served as generals. The eldest brother Lord Zhou Lü died in service; they enfeoffed his son Lü Tai as Marquis of Li and his son Chan as Marquis of Jiao; the next elder brother Lü Shizhi was Marquis of Jiancheng.

sentences.zh: 高祖十二年四月甲辰，崩長樂宮，太子襲號為帝。

translations.text: On the jiachen day of the fourth month in the twelfth year of Gao Zu, he died at Changle Palace; the Crown Prince inherited the title as Emperor.

sentences.zh: 是時高祖八子：長男肥，孝惠兄也，異母，肥為齊王；

translations.text: At this time Gao Zu had eight sons: the eldest son Fei was Emperor Xiaohui's elder brother by a different mother; Fei was King of Qi;

sentences.zh: 餘皆孝惠弟，戚姬子如意為趙王，薄夫人子恒為代王，諸姬子子恢為梁王，子友為淮陽王，子長為淮南王，子建為燕王。

translations.text: the rest were all Emperor Xiaohui's younger brothers—Consort Qi's son Ruyi was King of Zhao, Consort Bo's son Heng was King of Dai, various consorts' sons—Hui was King of Liang, You was King of Huaiyang, Chang was King of Huainan, and Jian was King of Yan.

sentences.zh: 高祖弟交為楚王，兄子濞為吳王。

translations.text: Gao Zu's younger brother Jiao was King of Chu; his nephew Bi was King of Wu.

sentences.zh: 非劉氏功臣番君吳芮子臣為長沙王。

translations.text: The non-Liu meritorious minister, son of Lord Fan Wu Rui, Chen, was King of Changsha.

On the jiachen day of the fourth month in the twelfth year of Gao Zu, he died at Changle Palace; the Crown Prince inherited the title as Emperor. At this time Gao Zu had eight sons: the eldest son Fei was Emperor Xiaohui's elder brother by a different mother; Fei was King of Qi; the rest were all Emperor Xiaohui's younger brothers—Consort Qi's son Ruyi was King of Zhao, Consort Bo's son Heng was King of Dai, various consorts' sons—Hui was King of Liang, You was King of Huaiyang, Chang was King of Huainan, and Jian was King of Yan. Gao Zu's younger brother Jiao was King of Chu; his nephew Bi was King of Wu. The non-Liu meritorious minister, son of Lord Fan Wu Rui, Chen, was King of Changsha.

sentences.zh: 呂后最怨戚夫人及其子趙王，乃令永巷囚戚夫人，而召趙王。

translations.text: Empress Lü most resented Consort Qi and her son the King of Zhao, so she ordered Consort Qi imprisoned in the Eternal Lanes and summoned the King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 使者三反，趙相建平侯周昌謂使者曰：「高帝屬臣趙王，趙王年少。

translations.text: After the envoy went three times, Zhao Prime Minister Marquis of Jianping Zhou Chang said to the envoy: "The High Emperor entrusted the King of Zhao to me; the King of Zhao is young.

sentences.zh: 竊聞太后怨戚夫人，欲召趙王并誅之，臣不敢遣王。

translations.text: I have secretly heard the Empress Dowager resents Consort Qi and wishes to summon the King of Zhao to execute them together; I dare not send the king.

sentences.zh: 王且亦病，不能奉詔。」

translations.text: Moreover, the king is also ill and cannot obey the edict."

sentences.zh: 呂后大怒，乃使人召趙相。

translations.text: Empress Lü was greatly enraged and sent men to summon the Zhao Prime Minister.

sentences.zh: 趙相徵至長安，乃使人復召趙王。

translations.text: The Zhao Prime Minister was summoned to Chang'an, and she then sent men again to summon the King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 王來，未到。

translations.text: The king came but had not yet arrived.

sentences.zh: 孝惠帝慈仁，知太后怒，自迎趙王霸上，與入宮，自挾與趙王起居飲食。

translations.text: Emperor Xiaohui was compassionate and benevolent; knowing the Empress Dowager was angry, he personally welcomed the King of Zhao at Bashang, entered the palace with him, and personally stayed close to the King of Zhao in daily activities and meals.

sentences.zh: 太后欲殺之，不得閒。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager wished to kill him but could not find an opportunity.

sentences.zh: 孝惠元年十二月，帝晨出射。

translations.text: In the twelfth month of the first year of Emperor Xiaohui, the emperor went out at dawn to practice archery.

sentences.zh: 趙王少，不能蚤起。

translations.text: The King of Zhao was young and could not rise early.

sentences.zh: 太后聞其獨居，使人持酖飲之。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager heard he was alone and sent someone with poisoned wine for him to drink.

sentences.zh: 犁明，孝惠還，趙王已死。

translations.text: At dawn, Emperor Xiaohui returned; the King of Zhao was already dead.

sentences.zh: 於是乃徙淮陽王友為趙王。

translations.text: Thereupon they moved King You of Huaiyang to be King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 夏，詔賜酈侯父追謚為令武侯。

translations.text: In summer, an edict bestowed on the Marquis of Li's father the posthumous title Lingwu Marquis.

sentences.zh: 太后遂斷戚夫人手足，去眼，煇耳，飲瘖藥，使居廁中，命曰「人彘」。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager then cut off Consort Qi's hands and feet, gouged out her eyes, seared her ears, made her drink a muting drug, had her reside in the privy, and named her 'Human Pig.'

sentences.zh: 居數日，乃召孝惠帝觀人彘。

translations.text: After several days, she summoned Emperor Xiaohui to observe the Human Pig.

sentences.zh: 孝惠見，問，乃知其戚夫人，乃大哭，因病，歲餘不能起。

translations.text: Emperor Xiaohui saw her, inquired, and then knew it was Consort Qi; he then wept loudly, consequently fell ill, and for over a year could not rise.

sentences.zh: 使人請太后曰：「此非人所為。

translations.text: He sent someone to request of the Empress Dowager: "This is not something a person would do.

sentences.zh: 臣為太后子，終不能治天下。」

translations.text: I am the Empress Dowager's son, yet in the end I cannot govern all under Heaven."

sentences.zh: 孝惠以此日飲為淫樂，不聽政，故有病也。

translations.text: From this day Emperor Xiaohui daily drank for dissolute pleasure and did not attend to government, which is why he had illness.

Empress Lü most resented Consort Qi and her son the King of Zhao, so she ordered Consort Qi imprisoned in the Eternal Lanes and summoned the King of Zhao. After the envoy went three times, Zhao Prime Minister Marquis of Jianping Zhou Chang said to the envoy: "The High Emperor entrusted the King of Zhao to me; the King of Zhao is young. I have secretly heard the Empress Dowager resents Consort Qi and wishes to summon the King of Zhao to execute them together; I dare not send the king. Moreover, the king is also ill and cannot obey the edict." Empress Lü was greatly enraged and sent men to summon the Zhao Prime Minister. The Zhao Prime Minister was summoned to Chang'an, and she then sent men again to summon the King of Zhao. The king came but had not yet arrived. Emperor Xiaohui was compassionate and benevolent; knowing the Empress Dowager was angry, he personally welcomed the King of Zhao at Bashang, entered the palace with him, and personally stayed close to the King of Zhao in daily activities and meals. The Empress Dowager wished to kill him but could not find an opportunity. In the twelfth month of the first year of Emperor Xiaohui, the emperor went out at dawn to practice archery. The King of Zhao was young and could not rise early. The Empress Dowager heard he was alone and sent someone with poisoned wine for him to drink. At dawn, Emperor Xiaohui returned; the King of Zhao was already dead. Thereupon they moved King You of Huaiyang to be King of Zhao. In summer, an edict bestowed on the Marquis of Li's father the posthumous title Lingwu Marquis. The Empress Dowager then cut off Consort Qi's hands and feet, gouged out her eyes, seared her ears, made her drink a muting drug, had her reside in the privy, and named her 'Human Pig.' After several days, she summoned Emperor Xiaohui to observe the Human Pig. Emperor Xiaohui saw her, inquired, and then knew it was Consort Qi; he then wept loudly, consequently fell ill, and for over a year could not rise. He sent someone to request of the Empress Dowager: "This is not something a person would do. I am the Empress Dowager's son, yet in the end I cannot govern all under Heaven." From this day Emperor Xiaohui daily drank for dissolute pleasure and did not attend to government, which is why he had illness.

sentences.zh: 二年，楚元王、齊悼惠王皆來朝。

translations.text: In the second year, King Yuan of Chu and King Daohui of Qi both came to court.

sentences.zh: 十月，孝惠與齊王燕飲太后前，孝惠以為齊王兄，置上坐，如家人之禮。

translations.text: In the tenth month, Emperor Xiaohui held a banquet and drank with the King of Qi before the Empress Dowager; Emperor Xiaohui considered the King of Qi his elder brother, placed him in the seat of honor, following the rites of family members.

sentences.zh: 太后怒，乃令酌兩卮酖，置前，令齊王起為壽。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager was angry and ordered two cups of poison poured and placed before them, ordering the King of Qi to rise and offer a toast.

sentences.zh: 齊王起，孝惠亦起，取卮欲俱為壽。

translations.text: The King of Qi rose; Emperor Xiaohui also rose, took the cup wishing to toast together.

sentences.zh: 太后乃恐，自起泛孝惠卮。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager was then afraid and personally rose to overturn Emperor Xiaohui's cup.

sentences.zh: 齊王怪之，因不敢飲，詳醉去。

translations.text: The King of Qi found this strange and consequently did not dare drink, feigned drunkenness, and departed.

sentences.zh: 問，知其酖，齊王恐，自以為不得脫長安，憂。

translations.text: Inquiring, he learned it was poison; the King of Qi was afraid, considering he could not escape Chang'an alive, and worried.

sentences.zh: 齊內史士說王曰：「太后獨有孝惠與魯元公主。

translations.text: Qi's Internal Administrator Shi persuaded the king, saying: "The Empress Dowager only has Emperor Xiaohui and Princess Lu Yuan.

sentences.zh: 今王有七十餘城，而公主乃食數城。

translations.text: Now the king has over seventy cities, while the princess eats from only several cities.

sentences.zh: 王誠以一郡上太后，為公主湯沐邑，太后必喜，王必無憂。」

translations.text: If the king truly offers one commandery to the Empress Dowager as a bathing estate for the princess, the Empress Dowager will certainly be pleased and the king will certainly have no worries."

sentences.zh: 於是齊王乃上城陽之郡，尊公主為王太后。

translations.text: Thereupon the King of Qi offered up the commandery of Chengyang and honored the princess as Queen Dowager.

sentences.zh: 呂后喜，許之。

translations.text: Empress Lü was pleased and permitted it.

sentences.zh: 乃置酒齊邸，樂飲，罷，歸齊王。

translations.text: She then held a banquet at the Qi residence, drank in enjoyment, dismissed it, and returned the King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 三年，方筑長安城，四年就半，五年六年城就。

translations.text: In the third year, they were constructing the walls of Chang'an; in the fourth year half was completed; in the fifth and sixth years the walls were completed.

sentences.zh: 諸侯來會。

translations.text: The feudal lords came to assemble.

sentences.zh: 十月朝賀。

translations.text: In the tenth month they came to court to offer congratulations.

In the second year, King Yuan of Chu and King Daohui of Qi both came to court. In the tenth month, Emperor Xiaohui held a banquet and drank with the King of Qi before the Empress Dowager; Emperor Xiaohui considered the King of Qi his elder brother, placed him in the seat of honor, following the rites of family members. The Empress Dowager was angry and ordered two cups of poison poured and placed before them, ordering the King of Qi to rise and offer a toast. The King of Qi rose; Emperor Xiaohui also rose, took the cup wishing to toast together. The Empress Dowager was then afraid and personally rose to overturn Emperor Xiaohui's cup. The King of Qi found this strange and consequently did not dare drink, feigned drunkenness, and departed. Inquiring, he learned it was poison; the King of Qi was afraid, considering he could not escape Chang'an alive, and worried. Qi's Internal Administrator Shi persuaded the king, saying: "The Empress Dowager only has Emperor Xiaohui and Princess Lu Yuan. Now the king has over seventy cities, while the princess eats from only several cities. If the king truly offers one commandery to the Empress Dowager as a bathing estate for the princess, the Empress Dowager will certainly be pleased and the king will certainly have no worries." Thereupon the King of Qi offered up the commandery of Chengyang and honored the princess as Queen Dowager. Empress Lü was pleased and permitted it. She then held a banquet at the Qi residence, drank in enjoyment, dismissed it, and returned the King of Qi. In the third year, they were constructing the walls of Chang'an; in the fourth year half was completed; in the fifth and sixth years the walls were completed. The feudal lords came to assemble. In the tenth month they came to court to offer congratulations.

sentences.zh: 七年秋八月戊寅，孝惠帝崩。

translations.text: On the wuyin day of the eighth month in the seventh year of autumn, Emperor Xiaohui died.

sentences.zh: 發喪，太后哭，泣不下。

translations.text: The death was announced; the Empress Dowager cried but tears did not fall.

sentences.zh: 留侯子張辟彊為侍中，年十五，謂丞相曰：「太后獨有孝惠，今崩，哭不悲，君知其解乎？」

translations.text: The Marquis of Liu's son Zhang Biqiang was an attendant, age fifteen, and said to the prime minister: "The Empress Dowager only had Emperor Xiaohui; now he has died and she cries without grief—do you know why?"

sentences.zh: 丞相曰：「何解？」

translations.text: The prime minister said: "What is the reason?"

sentences.zh: 辟彊曰：「帝毋壯子，太后畏君等。

translations.text: Biqiang said: "The emperor has no grown sons; the Empress Dowager fears you lords.

sentences.zh: 君今請拜呂臺、呂產、呂祿為將，將兵居南北軍，及諸呂皆入宮，居中用事，如此則太后心安，君等幸得脫禍矣。」

translations.text: If you lords now request to appoint Lü Tai, Lü Chan, and Lü Lu as generals commanding troops stationed at the Southern and Northern Armies, and have all the Lü clan enter the palace to reside within and handle affairs—if this is done then the Empress Dowager's heart will be at ease and you lords will be fortunate to escape disaster."

sentences.zh: 丞相乃如辟彊計。

translations.text: The prime minister then followed Biqiang's plan.

sentences.zh: 太后說，其哭乃哀。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager was pleased and her crying then became sorrowful.

sentences.zh: 呂氏權由此起。

translations.text: The Lü clan's power arose from this.

sentences.zh: 乃大赦天下。

translations.text: They then granted a great amnesty to all under Heaven.

sentences.zh: 九月辛丑，葬。

translations.text: On the xinchou day of the ninth month, they buried him.

sentences.zh: 太子即位為帝，謁高廟。

translations.text: The Crown Prince assumed the position as Emperor and made obeisance at the High Temple.

sentences.zh: 元年，號令一出太后。

translations.text: In the first year, all orders issued from the Empress Dowager.

On the wuyin day of the eighth month in the seventh year of autumn, Emperor Xiaohui died. The death was announced; the Empress Dowager cried but tears did not fall. The Marquis of Liu's son Zhang Biqiang was an attendant, age fifteen, and said to the prime minister: "The Empress Dowager only had Emperor Xiaohui; now he has died and she cries without grief—do you know why?" The prime minister said: "What is the reason?" Biqiang said: "The emperor has no grown sons; the Empress Dowager fears you lords. If you lords now request to appoint Lü Tai, Lü Chan, and Lü Lu as generals commanding troops stationed at the Southern and Northern Armies, and have all the Lü clan enter the palace to reside within and handle affairs—if this is done then the Empress Dowager's heart will be at ease and you lords will be fortunate to escape disaster." The prime minister then followed Biqiang's plan. The Empress Dowager was pleased and her crying then became sorrowful. The Lü clan's power arose from this. They then granted a great amnesty to all under Heaven. On the xinchou day of the ninth month, they buried him. The Crown Prince assumed the position as Emperor and made obeisance at the High Temple. In the first year, all orders issued from the Empress Dowager.

sentences.zh: 太后稱制，議欲立諸呂為王，問右丞相王陵。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager held power and discussed wishing to install various Lü as kings; she asked Right Prime Minister Wang Ling.

sentences.zh: 王陵曰：「高帝刑白馬盟曰『非劉氏而王，天下共擊之』。

translations.text: Wang Ling said: "The High Emperor slaughtered a white horse and made an oath saying 'If any non-Liu becomes king, all under Heaven shall together strike them.'

sentences.zh: 今王呂氏，非約也。」

translations.text: Now to make the Lü kings is not in accord with the agreement."

sentences.zh: 太后不說。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager was not pleased.

sentences.zh: 問左丞相陳平、絳侯周勃。

translations.text: She asked Left Prime Minister Chen Ping and Marquis of Jiang Zhou Bo.

sentences.zh: 勃等對曰：「高帝定天下，王子弟，今太后稱制，王昆弟諸呂，無所不可。」

translations.text: Bo and the others replied: "The High Emperor settled all under Heaven and made kings of his sons and younger brothers; now the Empress Dowager holds power—making kings of brothers and the various Lü, there is nothing improper about it."

sentences.zh: 太后喜，罷朝。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager was pleased and dismissed the court.

sentences.zh: 王陵讓陳平、絳侯曰：「始與高帝啑血盟，諸君不在邪？

translations.text: Wang Ling reproached Chen Ping and Marquis of Jiang, saying: "At first when we licked blood with the High Emperor in oath—were you lords not present?

sentences.zh: 今高帝崩，太后女主，欲王呂氏，諸君從欲阿意背約，何面目見高帝地下？」

translations.text: Now the High Emperor has died, the Empress Dowager is a female lord wishing to make the Lü kings, and you lords follow desires to flatter her intentions and betray the agreement—with what face will you see the High Emperor below ground?"

sentences.zh: 陳平、絳侯曰：「於今面折廷爭，臣不如君；

translations.text: Chen Ping and Marquis of Jiang said: "In opposing face to face and arguing at court now, we ministers are not your equal;

sentences.zh: 夫全社稷，定劉氏之後，君亦不如臣。」

translations.text: but in preserving the altars of soil and grain and stabilizing the Liu clan's succession, you are also not our equal."

sentences.zh: 王陵無以應之。

translations.text: Wang Ling had no response.

sentences.zh: 十一月，太后欲廢王陵，乃拜為帝太傅，奪之相權。

translations.text: In the eleventh month, the Empress Dowager wishing to remove Wang Ling appointed him Grand Tutor of the Emperor, taking away his prime ministerial authority.

sentences.zh: 王陵遂病免歸。

translations.text: Wang Ling then pleaded illness, was dismissed, and returned home.

sentences.zh: 乃以左丞相平為右丞相，以辟陽侯審食其為左丞相。

translations.text: She then made Left Prime Minister Ping Right Prime Minister and made Marquis of Biyang Shen Yiji Left Prime Minister.

sentences.zh: 左丞相不治事，令監宮中，如郎中令。

translations.text: The Left Prime Minister did not handle affairs but was ordered to supervise within the palace, like a Gentleman of the Palace.

sentences.zh: 食其故得幸太后，常用事，公卿皆因而決事。

translations.text: Yiji had formerly obtained the Empress Dowager's favor and constantly handled affairs; the dukes and ministers all went through him to decide matters.

sentences.zh: 乃追尊酈侯父為悼武王，欲以王諸呂為漸。

translations.text: They then posthumously honored the Marquis of Li's father as King Daowu, wishing to use this as a gradual approach to making the various Lü kings.

The Empress Dowager held power and discussed wishing to install various Lü as kings; she asked Right Prime Minister Wang Ling. Wang Ling said: "The High Emperor slaughtered a white horse and made an oath saying 'If any non-Liu becomes king, all under Heaven shall together strike them.' Now to make the Lü kings is not in accord with the agreement." The Empress Dowager was not pleased. She asked Left Prime Minister Chen Ping and Marquis of Jiang Zhou Bo. Bo and the others replied: "The High Emperor settled all under Heaven and made kings of his sons and younger brothers; now the Empress Dowager holds power—making kings of brothers and the various Lü, there is nothing improper about it." The Empress Dowager was pleased and dismissed the court. Wang Ling reproached Chen Ping and Marquis of Jiang, saying: "At first when we licked blood with the High Emperor in oath—were you lords not present? Now the High Emperor has died, the Empress Dowager is a female lord wishing to make the Lü kings, and you lords follow desires to flatter her intentions and betray the agreement—with what face will you see the High Emperor below ground?" Chen Ping and Marquis of Jiang said: "In opposing face to face and arguing at court now, we ministers are not your equal; but in preserving the altars of soil and grain and stabilizing the Liu clan's succession, you are also not our equal." Wang Ling had no response. In the eleventh month, the Empress Dowager wishing to remove Wang Ling appointed him Grand Tutor of the Emperor, taking away his prime ministerial authority. Wang Ling then pleaded illness, was dismissed, and returned home. She then made Left Prime Minister Ping Right Prime Minister and made Marquis of Biyang Shen Yiji Left Prime Minister. The Left Prime Minister did not handle affairs but was ordered to supervise within the palace, like a Gentleman of the Palace. Yiji had formerly obtained the Empress Dowager's favor and constantly handled affairs; the dukes and ministers all went through him to decide matters. They then posthumously honored the Marquis of Li's father as King Daowu, wishing to use this as a gradual approach to making the various Lü kings.

sentences.zh: 四月，太后欲侯諸呂，乃先封高祖之功臣郎中令無擇為博城侯。

translations.text: In the fourth month, the Empress Dowager wishing to make marquises of the various Lü first enfeoffed Gao Zu's meritorious minister, Gentleman of the Palace Wuze, as Marquis of Bocheng.

sentences.zh: 魯元公主薨，賜謚為魯元太后。

translations.text: Princess Lu Yuan died; they bestowed the posthumous title Grand Empress Dowager Lu Yuan.

sentences.zh: 子偃為魯王。

translations.text: Her son Yan was King of Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯王父，宣平侯張敖也。

translations.text: The King of Lu's father was Marquis of Xuanping Zhang Ao.

sentences.zh: 封齊悼惠王子章為朱虛侯，以呂祿女妻之。

translations.text: They enfeoffed King Daohui of Qi's son Zhang as Marquis of Zhuxu and married him to Lü Lu's daughter.

sentences.zh: 齊丞相壽為平定侯。

translations.text: Qi's Prime Minister Shou was Marquis of Pingding.

sentences.zh: 少府延為梧侯。

translations.text: Junior Supervisor Yan was Marquis of Wu.

sentences.zh: 乃封呂種為沛侯，呂平為扶柳侯，張買為南宮侯。

translations.text: They then enfeoffed Lü Zhong as Marquis of Pei, Lü Ping as Marquis of Fuliu, and Zhang Mai as Marquis of Nangong.

In the fourth month, the Empress Dowager wishing to make marquises of the various Lü first enfeoffed Gao Zu's meritorious minister, Gentleman of the Palace Wuze, as Marquis of Bocheng. Princess Lu Yuan died; they bestowed the posthumous title Grand Empress Dowager Lu Yuan. Her son Yan was King of Lu. The King of Lu's father was Marquis of Xuanping Zhang Ao. They enfeoffed King Daohui of Qi's son Zhang as Marquis of Zhuxu and married him to Lü Lu's daughter. Qi's Prime Minister Shou was Marquis of Pingding. Junior Supervisor Yan was Marquis of Wu. They then enfeoffed Lü Zhong as Marquis of Pei, Lü Ping as Marquis of Fuliu, and Zhang Mai as Marquis of Nangong.

sentences.zh: 太后欲王呂氏，先立孝惠後宮子彊為淮陽王，子不疑為常山王，子山為襄城侯，子朝為軹侯，子武為壺關侯。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager wishing to make the Lü kings first installed Emperor Xiaohui's palace sons—Qiang as King of Huaiyang, Buyi as King of Changshan, Shan as Marquis of Xiangcheng, Zhao as Marquis of Zhi, and Wu as Marquis of Huguan.

sentences.zh: 太后風大臣，大臣請立酈侯呂臺為呂王，太后許之。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager hinted to the great ministers; the great ministers requested to install Marquis of Li Lü Tai as King of Lü; the Empress Dowager permitted it.

sentences.zh: 建成康侯釋之卒，嗣子有罪，廢，立其弟呂祿為胡陵侯，續康侯後。

translations.text: Marquis Jiancheng Kang Shizhi died; his heir had committed a crime and was deposed; they installed his younger brother Lü Lu as Marquis of Huling to continue Marquis Kang's succession.

sentences.zh: 二年，常山王薨，以其弟襄城侯山為常山王，更名義。

translations.text: In the second year, the King of Changshan died; they made his younger brother Marquis of Xiangcheng Shan King of Changshan and changed his name to Yi.

sentences.zh: 十一月，呂王臺薨，謚為肅王，太子嘉代立為王。

translations.text: In the eleventh month, King Tai of Lü died; his posthumous title was King Su; Crown Prince Jia succeeded as king.

sentences.zh: 三年，無事。

translations.text: In the third year, there were no events.

sentences.zh: 四年，封呂媭為臨光侯，呂他為俞侯，呂更始為贅其侯，呂忿為呂城侯，及諸侯丞相五人。

translations.text: In the fourth year, they enfeoffed Lü Xu as Marquis of Linguang, Lü Ta as Marquis of Yu, Lü Gengshi as Marquis of Zhui Qi, Lü Fen as Marquis of Lü City, and five prime ministers of the feudal lords.

The Empress Dowager hinted to the great ministers; the great ministers requested to install Marquis of Li Lü Tai as King of Lü; the Empress Dowager permitted it. Marquis Jiancheng Kang Shizhi died; his heir had committed a crime and was deposed; they installed his younger brother Lü Lu as Marquis of Huling to continue Marquis Kang's succession. In the fourth year, they enfeoffed Lü Xu as Marquis of Linguang, Lü Ta as Marquis of Yu, Lü Gengshi as Marquis of Zhui Qi, Lü Fen as Marquis of Lü City, and five prime ministers of the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 宣平侯女為孝惠皇后時，無子，詳為有身，取美人子名之，殺其母，立所名子為太子。

translations.text: When the daughter of Marquis of Xuanping was Empress of Emperor Xiaohui, she had no son; pretending to be pregnant, she took a beautiful woman's son, named him, killed his mother, and installed the named son as Crown Prince.

sentences.zh: 孝惠崩，太子立為帝。

translations.text: Emperor Xiaohui died; the Crown Prince was installed as Emperor.

sentences.zh: 帝壯，或聞其母死，非真皇后子，乃出言曰：「后安能殺吾母而名我？

translations.text: When the emperor grew up, someone told him his mother had died and he was not the true empress's son; he then spoke out, saying: "How could the empress kill my mother and name me?

sentences.zh: 我未壯，壯即為變。」

translations.text: I am not yet grown; when I am grown I will make changes."

sentences.zh: 太后聞而患之，恐其為亂，乃幽之永卷中，言帝病甚，左右莫得見。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager heard this and was troubled by it; fearing he would create disorder, she imprisoned him in the Eternal Coils, said the emperor was severely ill, and none of those around him could see him.

sentences.zh: 太后曰：「凡有天下治為萬民命者，蓋之如天，容之如地，上有歡心以安百姓，百姓欣然以事其上，歡欣交通而天下治。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager said: "Those who possess all under Heaven and govern as the fate of the ten thousand people should cover them like Heaven and contain them like Earth; above having a joyful heart to comfort the hundred clans, the hundred clans delighting to serve their superior, joy and delight flowing between them and all under Heaven governed.

sentences.zh: 今皇帝病久不已，乃失惑惛亂，不能繼嗣奉宗廟祭祀，不可屬天下，其代之。」

translations.text: Now the emperor's illness has long not ceased; he has lost awareness and is confused and disordered, unable to continue succession to offer at the ancestral temples—all under Heaven cannot be entrusted to him; he should be replaced."

sentences.zh: 群臣皆頓首言：「皇太后為天下齊民計所以安宗廟社稷甚深，群臣頓首奉詔。」

translations.text: The assembled ministers all kowtowed and said: "The Empress Dowager on behalf of the common people of all under Heaven plans for the security of the ancestral temples and altars of soil and grain very deeply; the assembled ministers kowtow and receive the edict."

sentences.zh: 帝廢位，太后幽殺之。

translations.text: The emperor was deposed; the Empress Dowager imprisoned and killed him.

sentences.zh: 五月丙辰，立常山王義為帝，更名曰弘。

translations.text: On the bingchen day of the fifth month, they installed King Yi of Changshan as Emperor and changed his name to Hong.

sentences.zh: 不稱元年者，以太后制天下事也。

translations.text: They did not call it the first year because the Empress Dowager controlled the affairs of all under Heaven.

sentences.zh: 以軹侯朝為常山王。

translations.text: They made Marquis of Zhi Zhao King of Changshan.

sentences.zh: 置太尉官，絳侯勃為太尉。

translations.text: They established the position of Grand Commandant; Marquis of Jiang Bo became Grand Commandant.

sentences.zh: 五年八月，淮陽王薨，以弟壺關侯武為淮陽王。

translations.text: In the eighth month of the fifth year, the King of Huaiyang died; they made his younger brother Marquis of Huguan Wu King of Huaiyang.

sentences.zh: 六年十月，太后曰呂王嘉居處驕恣，廢之，以肅王臺弟呂產為呂王。

translations.text: In the tenth month of the sixth year, the Empress Dowager said King Jia of Lü was arrogant and self-indulgent in his residence and conduct and deposed him, making King Su Tai's younger brother Lü Chan King of Lü.

sentences.zh: 夏，赦天下。

translations.text: In summer, they pardoned all under Heaven.

sentences.zh: 封齊悼惠王子興居為東牟侯。

translations.text: They enfeoffed King Daohui of Qi's son Xingju as Marquis of Dongmou.

When the daughter of Marquis of Xuanping was Empress of Emperor Xiaohui, she had no son; pretending to be pregnant, she took a beautiful woman's son, named him, killed his mother, and installed the named son as Crown Prince. Emperor Xiaohui died; the Crown Prince was installed as Emperor. When the emperor grew up, someone told him his mother had died and he was not the true empress's son; he then spoke out, saying: "How could the empress kill my mother and name me? I am not yet grown; when I am grown I will make changes." The Empress Dowager heard this and was troubled by it; fearing he would create disorder, she imprisoned him in the Eternal Coils, said the emperor was severely ill, and none of those around him could see him. The Empress Dowager said: "Those who possess all under Heaven and govern as the fate of the ten thousand people should cover them like Heaven and contain them like Earth; above having a joyful heart to comfort the hundred clans, the hundred clans delighting to serve their superior, joy and delight flowing between them and all under Heaven governed. Now the emperor's illness has long not ceased; he has lost awareness and is confused and disordered, unable to continue succession to offer at the ancestral temples—all under Heaven cannot be entrusted to him; he should be replaced." The assembled ministers all kowtowed and said: "The Empress Dowager on behalf of the common people of all under Heaven plans for the security of the ancestral temples and altars of soil and grain very deeply; the assembled ministers kowtow and receive the edict." The emperor was deposed; the Empress Dowager imprisoned and killed him. On the bingchen day of the fifth month, they installed King Yi of Changshan as Emperor and changed his name to Hong. They did not call it the first year because the Empress Dowager controlled the affairs of all under Heaven. They made Marquis of Zhi Zhao King of Changshan. They established the position of Grand Commandant; Marquis of Jiang Bo became Grand Commandant. In the eighth month of the fifth year, the King of Huaiyang died; they made his younger brother Marquis of Huguan Wu King of Huaiyang. In the tenth month of the sixth year, the Empress Dowager said King Jia of Lü was arrogant and self-indulgent in his residence and conduct and deposed him, making King Su Tai's younger brother Lü Chan King of Lü. In summer, they pardoned all under Heaven. They enfeoffed King Daohui of Qi's son Xingju as Marquis of Dongmou.

sentences.zh: 七年正月，太后召趙王友。

translations.text: In the first month of the seventh year, the Empress Dowager summoned King You of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 友以諸呂女為受后，弗愛，愛他姬，諸呂女妒，怒去，讒之於太后，誣以罪過，曰：「呂氏安得王！

translations.text: You had taken a daughter of the various Lü as queen but did not love her, loving another consort; the Lü daughter was jealous, angrily departed, and slandered him to the Empress Dowager, falsely accusing him of crimes, saying: "How can the Lü obtain kingship!

sentences.zh: 太后百歲後，吾必擊之」。

translations.text: After the Empress Dowager's hundred years, I will certainly strike them."

sentences.zh: 太后怒，以故召趙王。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager was angry and consequently summoned the King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙王至，置邸不見，令衛圍守之，弗與食。

translations.text: When the King of Zhao arrived, they placed him in a residence and would not see him, ordered guards to surround and watch him, and would not give him food.

sentences.zh: 其群臣或竊饋，輒捕論之，趙王餓，乃歌曰：「諸呂用事兮劉氏危，迫脅王侯兮彊授我妃。

translations.text: Some of his assembled ministers secretly brought food; they would immediately arrest and prosecute them; the King of Zhao, starving, then sang: "The various Lü handle affairs and the Liu clan is endangered; they coerce kings and marquises and forcibly gave me a consort.

sentences.zh: 我妃既妒兮誣我以惡，讒女亂國兮上曾不寤。

translations.text: My consort being jealous slandered me with wickedness; slanderous women disorder the state and the superior never awakens.

sentences.zh: 我無忠臣兮何故棄國？

translations.text: I have no loyal ministers—why should I abandon my state?

sentences.zh: 自決中野兮蒼天舉直！

translations.text: I will end myself in the wilderness—may Heaven raise up the upright!

sentences.zh: 于嗟不可悔兮寧蚤自財。

translations.text: Alas, it cannot be undone—better to have ended myself earlier.

sentences.zh: 為王而餓死兮誰者憐之！

translations.text: To be a king and starve to death—who will pity this!

sentences.zh: 呂氏絕理兮託天報仇。」

translations.text: The Lü clan cuts off principle—I entrust Heaven to take revenge."

sentences.zh: 丁丑，趙王幽死，以民禮葬之長安民冢次。

translations.text: On the dingchou day, the King of Zhao died imprisoned; they buried him with commoner's rites in the commoner tomb grounds of Chang'an.

In the first month of the seventh year, the Empress Dowager summoned King You of Zhao. You had taken a daughter of the various Lü as queen but did not love her, loving another consort; the Lü daughter was jealous, angrily departed, and slandered him to the Empress Dowager, falsely accusing him of crimes, saying: "How can the Lü obtain kingship! After the Empress Dowager's hundred years, I will certainly strike them." The Empress Dowager was angry and consequently summoned the King of Zhao. When the King of Zhao arrived, they placed him in a residence and would not see him, ordered guards to surround and watch him, and would not give him food. Some of his assembled ministers secretly brought food; they would immediately arrest and prosecute them; the King of Zhao, starving, then sang: "The various Lü handle affairs and the Liu clan is endangered; they coerce kings and marquises and forcibly gave me a consort. My consort being jealous slandered me with wickedness; slanderous women disorder the state and the superior never awakens. I have no loyal ministers—why should I abandon my state? I will end myself in the wilderness—may Heaven raise up the upright! Alas, it cannot be undone—better to have ended myself earlier. To be a king and starve to death—who will pity this! The Lü clan cuts off principle—I entrust Heaven to take revenge." On the dingchou day, the King of Zhao died imprisoned; they buried him with commoner's rites in the commoner tomb grounds of Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 己丑，日食，晝晦。

translations.text: On the jichou day, there was a solar eclipse with darkness at midday.

sentences.zh: 太后惡之，心不樂，乃謂左右曰：「此為我也。」

translations.text: The Empress Dowager took this as a bad omen, was unhappy in her heart, and said to those around her: "This is because of me."
On the jichou day, there was a solar eclipse with darkness at midday. The Empress Dowager took this as a bad omen, was unhappy in her heart, and said to those around her: "This is because of me."

sentences.zh: 二月，徙梁王恢為趙王。

translations.text: In the second month, they moved King Hui of Liang to be King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 呂王產徙為梁王，梁王不之國，為帝太傅。

translations.text: King Chan of Lü was moved to be King of Liang; the King of Liang did not go to his state but became Grand Tutor of the Emperor.

sentences.zh: 立皇子平昌侯太為呂王。

translations.text: They installed the imperial son Marquis of Pingchang Tai as King of Lü.

sentences.zh: 更名梁曰呂，呂曰濟川。

translations.text: They renamed Liang as Lü and Lü as Jichuan.

sentences.zh: 太后女弟呂媭有女為營陵侯劉澤妻，澤為大將軍。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager's younger sister Lü Xu had a daughter who was wife to Marquis of Yingling Liu Ze; Ze was Grand General.

sentences.zh: 太后王諸呂，恐即崩後劉將軍為害，乃以劉澤為瑯邪王，以慰其心。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager making the various Lü kings feared that after she died General Liu would cause harm, so she made Liu Ze King of Langye to comfort his heart.

In the second month, they moved King Hui of Liang to be King of Zhao. King Chan of Lü was moved to be King of Liang; the King of Liang did not go to his state but became Grand Tutor of the Emperor. They installed the imperial son Marquis of Pingchang Tai as King of Lü. They renamed Liang as Lü and Lü as Jichuan. The Empress Dowager's younger sister Lü Xu had a daughter who was wife to Marquis of Yingling Liu Ze; Ze was Grand General. The Empress Dowager making the various Lü kings feared that after she died General Liu would cause harm, so she made Liu Ze King of Langye to comfort his heart.

sentences.zh: 梁王恢之徙王趙，心懷不樂。

translations.text: When King Hui of Liang was moved to be King of Zhao, his heart harbored unhappiness.

sentences.zh: 太后以呂產女為趙王后。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager made Lü Chan's daughter Queen of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 王后從官皆諸呂，擅權，微伺趙王，趙王不得自恣。

translations.text: The queen's attending officials were all various Lü who wielded power arbitrarily, secretly spied on the King of Zhao, and the King of Zhao could not act as he wished.

sentences.zh: 王有所愛姬，王后使人酖殺之。

translations.text: The king had a consort he loved; the queen sent someone to poison and kill her.

sentences.zh: 王乃為歌詩四章，令樂人歌之。

translations.text: The king then composed four chapters of songs and poems and had musicians sing them.

sentences.zh: 王悲，六月即自殺。

translations.text: The king grieved; in the sixth month he committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 太后聞之，以為王用婦人棄宗廟禮，廢其嗣。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager heard of this and considered that the king had abandoned ancestral temple rites because of a woman; she abolished his succession.

When King Hui of Liang was moved to be King of Zhao, his heart harbored unhappiness. The Empress Dowager made Lü Chan's daughter Queen of Zhao. The queen's attending officials were all various Lü who wielded power arbitrarily, secretly spied on the King of Zhao, and the King of Zhao could not act as he wished. The king had a consort he loved; the queen sent someone to poison and kill her. The king then composed four chapters of songs and poems and had musicians sing them. The king grieved; in the sixth month he committed suicide. The Empress Dowager heard of this and considered that the king had abandoned ancestral temple rites because of a woman; she abolished his succession.

sentences.zh: 宣平侯張敖卒，以子偃為魯王，敖賜謚為魯元王。

translations.text: Marquis of Xuanping Zhang Ao died; they made his son Yan King of Lu and bestowed on Ao the posthumous title King Lu Yuan.
Marquis of Xuanping Zhang Ao died; they made his son Yan King of Lu and bestowed on Ao the posthumous title King Lu Yuan.

sentences.zh: 秋，太后使使告代王，欲徙王趙。

translations.text: In autumn, the Empress Dowager sent an envoy to inform the King of Dai, wishing to move him to be King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 代王謝，願守代邊。

translations.text: The King of Dai declined, wishing to remain defending the Dai border.
In autumn, the Empress Dowager sent an envoy to inform the King of Dai, wishing to move him to be King of Zhao. The King of Dai declined, wishing to remain defending the Dai border.

sentences.zh: 太傅產、丞相平等言，武信侯呂祿上侯，位次第一，請立為趙王。

translations.text: Grand Tutor Chan, Prime Minister Ping, and others said Marquis of Wuxin Lü Lu was the highest marquis, ranked first in position, and requested he be installed as King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 太后許之，追尊祿父康侯為趙昭王。

translations.text: The Empress Dowager permitted it and posthumously honored Lu's father Marquis Kang as King Zhao of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 九月，燕靈王建薨，有美人子，太后使人殺之，無後，國除。

translations.text: In the ninth month, King Ling Jian of Yan died; he had a beautiful woman's son; the Empress Dowager sent men to kill him; without heir, the state was abolished.

sentences.zh: 八年十月，立呂肅王子東平侯呂通為燕王，封通弟呂莊為東平侯。

translations.text: In the tenth month of the eighth year, they installed King Su of Lü's son Marquis of Dongping Lü Tong as King of Yan and enfeoffed Tong's younger brother Lü Zhuang as Marquis of Dongping.

Grand Tutor Chan, Prime Minister Ping, and others said Marquis of Wuxin Lü Lu was the highest marquis, ranked first in position, and requested he be installed as King of Zhao. The Empress Dowager permitted it and posthumously honored Lu's father Marquis Kang as King Zhao of Zhao. In the ninth month, King Ling Jian of Yan died; he had a beautiful woman's son; the Empress Dowager sent men to kill him; without heir, the state was abolished. In the tenth month of the eighth year, they installed King Su of Lü's son Marquis of Dongping Lü Tong as King of Yan and enfeoffed Tong's younger brother Lü Zhuang as Marquis of Dongping.

sentences.zh: 三月中，呂后祓，還過軹道，見物如蒼犬，據高后掖，忽弗復見。

translations.text: In the third month, Empress Lü performed purification rites and on return passed through Zhidao; she saw something like a grey dog that grabbed the High Empress's armpit and suddenly disappeared.

sentences.zh: 卜之，云趙王如意為祟。

translations.text: They divined it; the oracle said it was King Ruyi of Zhao as an avenging spirit.

sentences.zh: 高后遂病掖傷。

translations.text: The High Empress then fell ill from the armpit wound.

In the third month, Empress Lü performed purification rites and on return passed through Zhidao; she saw something like a grey dog that grabbed the High Empress's armpit and suddenly disappeared. They divined it; the oracle said it was King Ruyi of Zhao as an avenging spirit. The High Empress then fell ill from the armpit wound.

sentences.zh: 高后為外孫魯元王偃年少，蚤失父母，孤弱，乃封張敖前姬兩子，侈為新都侯，壽為樂昌侯，以輔魯元王偃。

translations.text: The High Empress's external grandson King Yan of Lu Yuan was young, having lost his parents early, isolated and weak; she then enfeoffed Zhang Ao's former consort's two sons—Chi as Marquis of Xindu and Shou as Marquis of Lechang—to assist King Yan of Lu Yuan.

sentences.zh: 及封中大謁者張釋為建陵侯，呂榮為祝茲侯。

translations.text: She also enfeoffed Chief Herald Zhang Shi as Marquis of Jianling and Lü Rong as Marquis of Zhuzi.

sentences.zh: 諸中宦者令丞皆為關內侯，食邑五百戶。

translations.text: All palace eunuch directors and assistants were made marquises within the passes, with estates of five hundred households.

The High Empress's external grandson King Yan of Lu Yuan was young, having lost his parents early, isolated and weak; she then enfeoffed Zhang Ao's former consort's two sons—Chi as Marquis of Xindu and Shou as Marquis of Lechang—to assist King Yan of Lu Yuan. She also enfeoffed Chief Herald Zhang Shi as Marquis of Jianling and Lü Rong as Marquis of Zhuzi. All palace eunuch directors and assistants were made marquises within the passes, with estates of five hundred households.

sentences.zh: 七月中，高后病甚，乃令趙王呂祿為上將軍，軍北軍；

sentences.zh: 朱虛侯已殺產，帝命謁者持節勞朱虛侯。

translations.text: Having killed Chan, Marquis of Zhuxu, the emperor ordered a herald bearing a token to thank Marquis of Zhuxu.

sentences.zh: 朱虛侯欲奪節信，謁者不肯，朱虛侯則從與載，因節信馳走，斬長樂衛尉呂更始。

translations.text: Marquis of Zhuxu wished to seize the token; the herald refused; Marquis of Zhuxu then rode together with him in the chariot, and using the token galloped off, beheading Guard Commander of Changle Lü Gengshi.

sentences.zh: 還，馳入北軍，報太尉。

translations.text: Returning, he galloped into the Northern Army and reported to the Grand Commandant.

sentences.zh: 太尉起，拜賀朱虛侯曰：「所患獨呂產，今已誅，天下定矣。」

translations.text: The Grand Commandant rose and bowed in congratulation to Marquis of Zhuxu, saying: "What we feared was only Lü Chan; now he has been executed, all under Heaven is settled."

sentences.zh: 遂遣人分部悉捕諸呂男女，無少長皆斬之。

translations.text: They then sent men to divide into sections to completely arrest all Lü males and females; none, young or old, were spared—all were beheaded.

sentences.zh: 辛酉，捕斬呂祿，而笞殺呂媭。

translations.text: On the xinyou day, they arrested and beheaded Lü Lu and flogged Lü Xu to death.

sentences.zh: 使人誅燕王呂通，而廢魯王偃。

translations.text: They sent men to execute King Lü Tong of Yan and deposed King Yan of Lu.

sentences.zh: 壬戌，以帝太傅食其復為左丞相。

translations.text: On the renxu day, they made Grand Tutor of the Emperor Yiji again Left Prime Minister.

sentences.zh: 戊辰，徙濟川王王梁，立趙幽王子遂為趙王。

translations.text: On the wuchen day, they moved King of Jichuan to rule Liang and installed the son of King You of Zhao, Sui, as King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 遣朱虛侯章以誅諸呂氏事告齊王，令罷兵。

translations.text: They sent Marquis of Zhuxu Zhang to inform the King of Qi of the matter of executing the various Lü clan and ordered him to dismiss his troops.

sentences.zh: 灌嬰兵亦罷滎陽而歸。

translations.text: Guan Ying's troops also dismissed from Yingyang and returned.

Having killed Chan, Marquis of Zhuxu, the emperor ordered a herald bearing a token to thank Marquis of Zhuxu. Marquis of Zhuxu wished to seize the token; the herald refused; Marquis of Zhuxu then rode together with him in the chariot, and using the token galloped off, beheading Guard Commander of Changle Lü Gengshi. Returning, he galloped into the Northern Army and reported to the Grand Commandant. The Grand Commandant rose and bowed in congratulation to Marquis of Zhuxu, saying: "What we feared was only Lü Chan; now he has been executed, all under Heaven is settled." They then sent men to divide into sections to completely arrest all Lü males and females; none, young or old, were spared—all were beheaded. On the xinyou day, they arrested and beheaded Lü Lu and flogged Lü Xu to death. They sent men to execute King Lü Tong of Yan and deposed King Yan of Lu. On the renxu day, they made Grand Tutor of the Emperor Yiji again Left Prime Minister. On the wuchen day, they moved King of Jichuan to rule Liang and installed the son of King You of Zhao, Sui, as King of Zhao. They sent Marquis of Zhuxu Zhang to inform the King of Qi of the matter of executing the various Lü clan and ordered him to dismiss his troops. Guan Ying's troops also dismissed from Yingyang and returned.

sentences.zh: 諸大臣相與陰謀曰：「少帝及梁、淮陽、常山王，皆非真孝惠子也。

translations.text: The various great ministers secretly plotted together, saying: "The young emperor and the kings of Liang, Huaiyang, and Changshan are all not truly sons of Emperor Xiaohui.

sentences.zh: 呂后以計詐名他人子，殺其母，養後宮，令孝惠子之，立以為後，及諸王，以彊呂氏。

translations.text: Empress Lü by stratagem deceitfully named other people's sons, killed their mothers, raised them in the rear palace, had Emperor Xiaohui claim them as sons, and installed them as heirs and as the various kings to strengthen the Lü clan.

sentences.zh: 今皆已夷滅諸呂，而置所立，即長用事，吾屬無類矣。

translations.text: Now we have already exterminated all the various Lü, yet if we keep those who were installed and they grow up to handle affairs, we will have no posterity.

sentences.zh: 不如視諸王最賢者立之。」

translations.text: It would be better to examine which of the kings is most worthy and install him."

sentences.zh: 或言「齊悼惠王高帝長子，今其適子為齊王，推本言之，高帝適長孫，可立也」。

translations.text: Some said: "King Daohui of Qi was the High Emperor's eldest son; now his legitimate son is King of Qi; tracing it to the origin, he is the High Emperor's legitimate eldest grandson and can be installed."

sentences.zh: 大臣皆曰：「呂氏以外家惡而幾危宗廟，亂功臣今齊王母家駟（鈞），駟鈞，惡人也。

translations.text: The great ministers all said: "The Lü clan as external family were wicked and nearly endangered the ancestral temples, disordering the meritorious ministers; now the King of Qi's maternal family is Sijun—Sijun are wicked people.

sentences.zh: 即立齊王，則復為呂氏。」

translations.text: If we install the King of Qi, it will again become like the Lü clan."

sentences.zh: 欲立淮南王，以為少，母家又惡。

translations.text: They wished to install the King of Huainan but considered him young and his maternal family also wicked.

sentences.zh: 乃曰：「代王方今高帝見子，最長，仁孝寬厚。

translations.text: They then said: "The King of Dai is presently the High Emperor's surviving son, the eldest, benevolent, filial, generous, and magnanimous.

sentences.zh: 太后家薄氏謹良。

translations.text: The Grand Empress's family, the Bo clan, are careful and good.

sentences.zh: 且立長故順，以仁孝聞於天下，便。」

translations.text: Moreover, installing the eldest follows proper order; as he is known for benevolence and filial piety throughout all under Heaven, it is convenient."

sentences.zh: 乃相與共陰使人召代王。

translations.text: They then together secretly sent men to summon the King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 代王使人辭謝。

translations.text: The King of Dai sent men to decline and express thanks.

sentences.zh: 再反，然後乘六乘傳。

translations.text: After going back and forth twice, he then rode in six relay chariots.

sentences.zh: 後九月晦日己酉，至長安，舍代邸。

translations.text: On the last day of the ninth month, the jiyou day, he reached Chang'an and lodged at the Dai residence.

sentences.zh: 大臣皆往謁，奉天子璽上代王，共尊立為天子。

translations.text: The great ministers all went to pay respects, presented the Son of Heaven's seal to the King of Dai, and together honored and installed him as Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 代王數讓，群臣固請，然後聽。

translations.text: The King of Dai declined several times; the assembled ministers firmly requested, and then he listened.

The various great ministers secretly plotted together, saying: "The young emperor and the kings of Liang, Huaiyang, and Changshan are all not truly sons of Emperor Xiaohui. Empress Lü by stratagem deceitfully named other people's sons, killed their mothers, raised them in the rear palace, had Emperor Xiaohui claim them as sons, and installed them as heirs and as the various kings to strengthen the Lü clan. Now we have already exterminated all the various Lü, yet if we keep those who were installed and they grow up to handle affairs, we will have no posterity. It would be better to examine which of the kings is most worthy and install him." Some said: "King Daohui of Qi was the High Emperor's eldest son; now his legitimate son is King of Qi; tracing it to the origin, he is the High Emperor's legitimate eldest grandson and can be installed." The great ministers all said: "The Lü clan as external family were wicked and nearly endangered the ancestral temples, disordering the meritorious ministers; now the King of Qi's maternal family is Sijun—Sijun are wicked people. If we install the King of Qi, it will again become like the Lü clan." They wished to install the King of Huainan but considered him young and his maternal family also wicked. They then said: "The King of Dai is presently the High Emperor's surviving son, the eldest, benevolent, filial, generous, and magnanimous. The Grand Empress's family, the Bo clan, are careful and good. Moreover, installing the eldest follows proper order; as he is known for benevolence and filial piety throughout all under Heaven, it is convenient." They then together secretly sent men to summon the King of Dai. The King of Dai sent men to decline and express thanks. After going back and forth twice, he then rode in six relay chariots. On the last day of the ninth month, the jiyou day, he reached Chang'an and lodged at the Dai residence. The great ministers all went to pay respects, presented the Son of Heaven's seal to the King of Dai, and together honored and installed him as Son of Heaven. The King of Dai declined several times; the assembled ministers firmly requested, and then he listened.

sentences.zh: 東牟侯興居曰：「誅呂氏吾無功，請得除宮。」

translations.text: Marquis of Dongmou Xingju said: "In executing the Lü clan I had no merit; I request to be allowed to purge the palace."

sentences.zh: 乃與太仆汝陰侯滕公入宮，前謂少帝曰：「足下非劉氏，不當立。」

translations.text: He then with Grand Coachman Marquis of Ruyin Duke Teng entered the palace, went before the young emperor and said: "You are not of the Liu clan and should not be installed."

sentences.zh: 乃顧麾左右執戟者掊兵罷去。

translations.text: He then looked back and gestured to those around holding halberds to lay down their weapons and withdraw.

sentences.zh: 有數人不肯去兵，宦者令張澤諭告，亦去兵。

translations.text: Several men refused to lay down their weapons; Eunuch Commander Zhang Ze instructed and informed them, and they also laid down their weapons.

sentences.zh: 滕公乃召乘輿車載少帝出。

translations.text: Duke Teng then summoned the imperial chariot to carry the young emperor out.

sentences.zh: 少帝曰：「欲將我安之乎？」

translations.text: The young emperor said: "Where do you wish to take me?"

sentences.zh: 滕公曰「出就舍。」

translations.text: Duke Teng said: "Going out to your residence."

sentences.zh: 舍少府。

translations.text: They lodged him at the Junior Supervisor's.

sentences.zh: 乃奉天子法駕，迎代王於邸。

translations.text: They then presented the Son of Heaven's ceremonial procession and welcomed the King of Dai at the residence.

sentences.zh: 報曰：「宮謹除。」

translations.text: They reported: "The palace has been carefully purged."

sentences.zh: 代王即夕入未央宮。

translations.text: The King of Dai that very evening entered Weiyang Palace.

sentences.zh: 有謁者十人持戟衛端門，曰：「天子在也，足下何為者而入？」

translations.text: There were ten heralds holding halberds defending the端 Gate who said: "The Son of Heaven is within—who are you and why do you enter?"

sentences.zh: 代王乃謂太尉。

translations.text: The King of Dai then addressed the Grand Commandant.

sentences.zh: 太尉往諭，謁者十人皆掊兵而去。

translations.text: The Grand Commandant went to instruct them; the ten heralds all laid down their weapons and departed.

sentences.zh: 代王遂入而聽政。

translations.text: The King of Dai then entered and attended to government.

sentences.zh: 夜，有司分部誅滅梁、淮陽、常山王及少帝於邸。

translations.text: By night, the officials divided into sections to execute and exterminate the kings of Liang, Huaiyang, and Changshan as well as the young emperor at their residences.

sentences.zh: 代王立為天子。

translations.text: The King of Dai was installed as Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 二十三年崩，謚為孝文皇帝。

translations.text: After twenty-three years he died; his posthumous title was Emperor Xiaowen.

Marquis of Dongmou Xingju said: "In executing the Lü clan I had no merit; I request to be allowed to purge the palace." He then with Grand Coachman Marquis of Ruyin Duke Teng entered the palace, went before the young emperor and said: "You are not of the Liu clan and should not be installed." He then looked back and gestured to those around holding halberds to lay down their weapons and withdraw. Several men refused to lay down their weapons; Eunuch Commander Zhang Ze instructed and informed them, and they also laid down their weapons. Duke Teng then summoned the imperial chariot to carry the young emperor out. The young emperor said: "Where do you wish to take me?" Duke Teng said: "Going out to your residence." They lodged him at the Junior Supervisor's. They then presented the Son of Heaven's ceremonial procession and welcomed the King of Dai at the residence. They reported: "The palace has been carefully purged." The King of Dai that very evening entered Weiyang Palace. There were ten heralds holding halberds defending the端 Gate who said: "The Son of Heaven is within—who are you and why do you enter?" The King of Dai then addressed the Grand Commandant. The Grand Commandant went to instruct them; the ten heralds all laid down their weapons and departed. The King of Dai then entered and attended to government. By night, the officials divided into sections to execute and exterminate the kings of Liang, Huaiyang, and Changshan as well as the young emperor at their residences. The King of Dai was installed as Son of Heaven. After twenty-three years he died; his posthumous title was Emperor Xiaowen.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：孝惠皇帝、高后之時，黎民得離戰國之苦，君臣俱欲休息乎無為，故惠帝垂拱，高后女主稱制，政不出房戶，天下晏然。

translations.text: The Grand Historian says: In the time of Emperor Xiaohui and the High Empress, the common people were able to leave behind the suffering of the Warring States; lords and ministers both wished to rest in non-action, therefore Emperor Hui folded his hands and垂拱, the High Empress as female lord held power, governance did not leave the chambers, and all under Heaven was tranquil.

sentences.zh: 刑罰罕用，罪人是希。

translations.text: Punishments were rarely used; criminals were few.

sentences.zh: 民務稼穡，衣食滋殖。

translations.text: The people focused on agriculture; clothing and food grew abundant.
